examples: her hair was still damp from the shower

noun.description: Moisture diffused through the air or a solid substance or condensed on a surface, typically with detrimental or unpleasant effects.

examples: shame gave a damp to her triumph
damp a small area with water

verb.description: Make a fire burn less strongly by reducing the flow of air to it.
Restrict the amplitude of vibrations on (a piano or other musical instrument) so as to reduce the volume of sound.
examples: rapidly damping the cymbals after repeatedly clashing them together

origin: Middle English (in the noun sense noxious inhalation): of West Germanic origin; related to a Middle Low German word meaning vapor, steam, smoke.
